resources.string:
Privacy Policy 
 

Overview Your privacy is very important to us. We keep the following fundamental guidelines when operating our service (website and apps): 
 

We don	 ask you for personal information unless we truly need it.
 We don	 store sensitive personal information on our servers. 
 
 The applications do not send us any critically important information like your login credentials; instead those are encrypted and stored locally in your device. Your social information displayed to other people is subjected to the restrictions and permissions that you have defined in your account in each of your social networks. We don	 share your information with anyone except to comply with the law. 
 
 We may use non-personal statistical information to analyze the use in our website and apps, and that\s in order to improve our service; diagnose technical problems, improve UI and features, maintain security, etc. The Privacy Policy applies to all users of the Service, including developers, users who are also contributors of content, information, and other materials or services.
This application can access its exact position and is a risk for your privacy.
Displays ads while in use, including banners, pop-ups, and other graphics. The ads are common in free apps.
Not used for this alarm type
You can have Battery Saver notify you when your battery level reaches a certain point (e.g., the battery becomes fully charged, the battery level drops below 20%).

This page allows you to add new alarms, quickly enable or disable existing alarms, or delete alarms.


To add a new alarm, press "Add alarm" — this will create a new alarm and take you to the alarm settings page, where you can control the settings for the new alarm. See the help on that page for more details.


Below the "Add alarm" button is a list of any alarms you have created.


• To edit an existing alarm, just press it. 
• To delete an alarm, long-press it, then select "Delete Alarm". (You can also delete an alarm from the individual alarm settings page by pressing MENU then "Delete Alarm".) 
• To quickly toggle whether an alarm is enabled, press the alarm clock icon to the left of the alarm text. (You can also enable or disable an alarm from the individual alarm settings page.)
This are experimental features which will be available in the future, but you can test them now.
This app can initiate a phone call without going through the Dialer user interface for the user to confirm the call. This can add charges to data plan and is a HIGH privacy risk.
This application can access the camera device and is a risk for your privacy.
Enter the new password\n4 or more digits is recommended
%1$s won\'t work unless you enable Google Play services.
%1$s won\'t run without Google Play services, which are missing from your device.
%1$s is having trouble with Google Play services. Please try again.
%1$s won\'t run without Google Play services, which are not supported by your device.
%1$s won\'t run unless you update Google Play services.
%1$s won\'t run without Google Play services, which are currently updating.
New version of Google Play services needed. It will update itself shortly.

Battery Saver will be completely closed, and you won't see it in your status bar any more. Any desktop widgets will be useless.


If you just want to leave the main window and keep the service running, press Cancel and then just press your device's BACK button to leave the main window.


If you want to hide the notification but keep widgets running, press Cancel and then run the Notification Wizard to hide the notification.
Hint: Disable this confirmation dialog in the settings...

Warning: Changing this setting (both enabling and disabling it) will reset your color settings.\n
\nIf you have a Motorola Droid, Droid X, Droid 2, Defy, or Samsung Moment, you should turn this on when you first get the app, and then leave it alone. All other devices, as far as I know, should always leave this off.
Allow Ad to create a calendar event?
The hack MIGHT work on this device.

Android does NOT provide a means for apps to access information about the battery current. However, a hack is available that allows many devices to potentially get this information.


This is NOT guaranteed to work. It may not work at all or it may appear to work but only result in nonsense values.


Settings to turn on the hack, if possible, and control how it is used are available in this section.
Advanced settings for enabling mA info

Applocker can lock any apps you choose, with abundant options, protecting your privacy. App Locker can hide pictures and videos, App Locker empowers you to control photo and video access.
With this app, you don't have to worry about your private information on your phone to be exposed to other people. You don't have to worry about your friends messing your phone up by changing the settings. 

 Features: 
 Smart Features
 
✔ Lock System Apps - Gallery, SMS, Contacts, Gmail, Playstore, File Manager, Call, Dialer, Call Logs, You tube, Video player etc. 
✔ Lock Downloaded Apps - Whats App, Facebook, Instagram, WeChat, Snap Chat, Skype, BBM, Line, Twitter, Games, etc. 
✔ Lock Advanced Apps - Uninstall, Settings, Task manager, SD Folders etc. 
✔ A Vault to hide Photos & Videos 
✔ Support theme, such as dark themes. 
✔ Hide App Icon 
✔ Lock incoming & outgoing calls
You want to trust this application?
Shows how to use with an actionbar
Sample menu item with overflow button
File successfully written to root of SD card.
Consider folowing the Google Plus Page for announcements and polls.

This software is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.\n
\nWhile I do my best to make sure that it works well and does not cause problems, I am not responsible for any damage or inconvenience it may cause under any circumstance.
Battery Saver does not collect, store, or transmit any personal information.

If you forget your unlock pattern, you can reset it bt answering the Security Question
Installing apps from unknown sources can lead to malware. Go to Settings>Security and then disable Unknown Sources.
Please help us improve and add new features by leaving a positive review on Google Play
If you like this app, consider helping improve it by sharing it with your friends.

AboutLibraries is a library to offer you all the information you need of your libraries!

Most modern apps feature an "Used Library"-Section and for this some information of those libs is required. As it gets annoying to copy those strings always to your app I have developed this small helper library to provide the required information.
ActionBar-PullToRefresh provides an easy way to add a modern version of the pull-to-refresh interaction to your application.
ActionBarSherlock is an standalone library designed to facilitate the use of the action bar design pattern across all versions of Android through a single API.
ActiveAndroid is an active record style ORM (object relational mapper).
This library allows you to include vector icons everywhere in your project. No limits are given. Scale with no limit, use any Color at any time, provide a contour, and many additional customizations
Standalone Android widget for picking a single date from a calendar view.
Paging indicator widgets that are compatible with the ViewPager from the Android Support Library to improve discoverability of content.
This library adds support for the Action Bar user interface design pattern. This library includes support for material design user interface implementations.
Field and method binding for Android views which uses annotation processing to generate boilerplate code for you.
Custom view for circular images in Android while maintaining the best draw performance
Yet another implementation of Floating Action Button for Android with lots of features.
The Crashlytics Kit for Android provides simple APIs for reporting crashes.
Crouton is a class that can be used by Android developers that feel the need for an alternative to the Context insensitive Toast.
A fast dependency injector for Android and Java.
A fast dependency injector for Android and Java.

A custom view that displays an error image, a title, and a subtitle given an HTTP status code. It can be used for various other purposes like displaying other kinds of errors, or just messages with images.
EventBus is an Android optimized publish/subscribe event bus.
FButton is a custom Button of Android with Flat UI concept. FButton\'s design get inspiration from designmono. This library is very small and highly customizable.
Integrate Android apps with Facebook Platform.
Android Google+ like floating action button which reacts on the list view scrolling events. Becomes visible when the list view is scrolled up and invisible when scrolled down.

With Google Play services, your app can take advantage of the latest, Google-powered features such as Maps, Google+, and more, with automatic platform updates distributed as an APK through the Google Play store.

This library is an open-source set of graph types that are easy to add to your app, and in addition, look gorgeous. Themed in the much-loved Holo style of Android, the graphing library should fit in with any of your modern, standards-compliant apps.
A simple Android class for encrypting & decrypting strings, aiming to avoid the classic mistakes that most such classes suffer from.
jsoup is a Java library for working with real-world HTML. It provides a very convenient API for extracting and manipulating data, using the best of DOM, CSS, and jquery-like methods.
A memory leak detection library for Android and Java.
Screaming fast JSON parsing and serialization library for Android.
An android custom view that displays a circle with a colored arc given a mark.
MaterialRangeBar is a fork of https://github.com/edmodo/range-bar that adds some basic material styling, as well as start and end values, values as floats and some other things.
A material style progress wheel compatible with 2.3.
Extremely light way to execute code in the background on Android. Alternative to AsyncTask.
Android library for using the Honeycomb (Android 3.0) animation API on all versions of the platform back to 1.0!
An HTTP and SPDY client for Android and Java applications
Otto is an enhanced event bus with emphasis on Android support.
Interactive paging indicator widget, compatible with the ViewPager from the Android Support Library.
Paper is a fast NoSQL data storage for Android that lets you save/restore Java objects by using efficient Kryo serialization and handling data structure changes automatically.
A powerful image downloading and caching library for Android.
Process Phoenix facilitates restarting your application process.
QuickReturn is a library which showcases the QuickReturn UI Pattern. The QuickReturn UI Pattern reveals or hides a header or footer as content is scrolled up or down.
A powerful Recyclerview wrapper for working with Realm as your datastore.
A simple and powerful EditText and RecyclerView UI component. It\'s build on top of RealmRecyclerView and RealmBasedRecyclerViewAdapter.
Realm is a mobile database: a replacement for SQLite & ORMs
The easiest way to create adapters! You can add a lot of different layouts and models. This library avoid all the boilerplates needed to create a list for your application.
A type-safe REST client for Android and Java.
RxJava binding APIs for Android\'s UI widgets.

The ShowcaseView library is designed to highlight and showcase specific parts of apps to the user with a distinctive and attractive overlay. This library is great for pointing out points of interest for users, gestures, or obscure but useful items.
This library includes support for application components, user interface features, accessibility, data handling, network connectivity, and programming utilities.
A logger with a small, extensible API which provides utility on top of Android\'s normal Log class.
Free (do whatever you want) high-resolution photos.
Flexible charting library with nice motion capabilities.
Alexei is a type-face Image Processor that allows developers to easily perform calculations over images.
DialogFragments modeled after the 4.2 Alarm Clock TimePicker to improve UX for picking time, date, and numbers.

Iconify allows you to include any of the 361 FontAwesome icons by Dave Gandy in your texts, your ActionBar, and even in your EditTexts. Icons are infinitely scalable, and customizable with shadows and everything you can do on texts.
Backport of material dialogs with easy-to-use API based on DialogFragment. This library makes styling and using dialogs a piece of cake.
This RecyclerView extension library provides Google\'s Inbox app like swiping, Play Music app like drag-and-drop sorting and expandable item features. Works on API level 9 or later.
Yet another library for drawing Material Design promoted actions
Views and Drawable for displaying animated GIFs on Android
This open-source library contains classes that are useful for a wide range of applications using the Google Maps Android API.
Google Maps Android API utility library
The Easter Egg in the Android Settings App in Android Marshmallow, when you click multiple times on the version number. NOW CUSTOMIZABLE!
Easily upload files in the background with automatic Android Notification Center progress indication.

AndroidAnnotations is an Open Source framework that speeds up Android development. It takes care of the plumbing, and lets you concentrate on what\'s really important. By simplifying your code, it facilitates its maintenance.

AsyncService is born from an article I wrote a few weeks ago, which gave me a lot of feedbacks and interesting comments. AsyncService manages threading and caching transparently in your Android app. It is an alternative to AsyncTasks, Loaders, or more advanced libs like RxJava, Robospice, Groundy,… but AsyncService focuses on keeping your code short and simple!
CountryPicker is a simple fragment that can be embedded or shown as dialog. See the example to see more detail.
Extended linear layout that wrap its content when there is no place in the current line.
This is a simple, straight-forward implementation of the Android v3 In-app billing API. It supports: In-App Product Purchases (both non-consumable and consumable) and Subscriptions.
Colorful progress bar with round corner on progress which you can customized a color and corner radius. A library has two type of progress bar.
Android Sliding Up Panel provides a simple way to add a draggable sliding up panel (popularized by Google Music, Google Maps and Rdio) to your Android application

UIL aims to provide a powerful, flexible and highly customizable instrument for image loading, caching and displaying. It provides a lot of configuration options and good control over the image loading and caching process.
A beautiful view to create a minimalistic hover effect over an ImageView
This library adds support for the Action Bar user interface design pattern.
AppIntro is an Android Library that helps you make a cool intro for your app, like the ones in Google apps.
Assent is designed to make Marshmallow\'s runtime permissions easier to use. Have the flexibility of request permissions and receiving results through callback interfaces.
Android component which presents a dismissible view from the bottom of the screen.

Bridge is a simple but powerful HTTP networking library for Android. It features a Fluent chainable API, powered by Java/Android\'s URLConnection classes for maximum compatibility and speed.
Caldroid is a fragment that display calendar with dates in a month. Caldroid can be used as embedded fragment, or as dialog fragment. User can also swipe left/right to navigate to different months.
Custom fonts in Android the easy way…
Card Library provides an easy way to display a UI Card using the Official Google CardView in your Android app
Google’s Now popular Cards UI has everyone fascinated. This library aims to mimick this widget.
A lightweight viewpager indicator like in nexus 5 launcher

This repository provides a simple collection of Color Picker.
• Color Picker from Stock Calendar
• Color Picker from Dashclock
Commons IO is a library of utilities to assist with developing IO functionality.
You can easily add awesome animated context menu to your app.
CrossfadeDrawerLayout. Add a 2-Step DrawerLayout to your application, with a nice crossfade effect.
This library allows launching a custom activity when the app crashes, instead of showing the hated "Unfortunately, X has stopped" dialog.

This library enables your Java application to handle property lists of various formats.

Property lists are files used to store user settings and serialized objects. They originate from the NeXSTEP programming environment and are now a basic part of the Cocoa framework (OS X and iOS) as well as the GNUstep framework.

The Design package provides APIs to support adding material design components and patterns to your apps. The Design Support library adds support for various material design components and patterns for app developers to build upon, such as navigation drawers, floating action buttons (FAB), snackbars, and tabs.
DiscreteSeekbar is my poor attempt to develop an android implementation of the Discrete Slider component from the Google Material Design Guidelines
Set of light and non-invasive extensions for Android RecyclerView widget. Does not use custom RecyclerView or LayoutManager. With this extensions you can create RecyclerView with following features:
A small library containing a wrapper/helper for the shared preferences of Android. With this library you can initialize the shared preference inside the onCreate of the Application class of your app.

Easy Android Animations is an animation library that aims to make android animations easier, with 50+ builtin animations, it allows you to introduce many complex animation effects in your application with one or two lines of code.
Encryption is a simple way to create encrypted strings to Android project.
FastAdapter, the bullet proof, fast and easy to use adapter library, which minimizes developing time to a fraction...
A search view that implements a floating search bar also known as persistent search
Single Sign-on Library for Android applications to use Foursquare app for authorization.

Glide is a fast and efficient open source media management and image loading framework for Android that wraps media decoding, memory and disk caching, and resource pooling into a simple and easy to use interface.
greenDAO is a light and fast ORM solution for Android that maps objects to SQLite databases.
Gson is a Java library that can be used to convert Java Objects into their JSON representation.
A set of GSON serialiser/deserialisers for dealing with Joda Time entities.

The Guava project contains several of Google\'s core libraries that we rely on in our Java-based projects: collections, caching, primitives support, concurrency libraries, common annotations, string processing, I/O, and so forth.
Secure, simple key-value storage for android
Charting library for Android compatible with API 8+(Android 2.2).
A set of annotations used for code inspection support and code documentation.
Android Asynchronous Networking and Image Loading Library

Inspired by the quality and variety of XML tooling available for the Java platform (StAX, JAXB, etc.), the Jackson is a multi-purpose Java library for processing JSON data format. Jackson aims to be the best possible combination of fast, correct, lightweight, and ergonomic for developers.
Joda-Time is a date and time library that vastly improves on the JDK.
A small library replicating the new dialogs in android L.

Google\'s common Java, C++ and Javascript library for parsing, formatting, storing and validating international phone numbers. The Java version is optimized for running on smartphones, and is used by the Android framework since 4.0 (Ice Cream Sandwich)
A Java implementation of the Magister 6 API for desktop and Android.
A beautiful, easy-to-use, and customizable dialogs API, enabling you to use Material designed dialogs down to API 8
MaterialDrawer the flexible, easy to use, all in one drawer library for your Android project.
MaterialEditText, the EditText in Material Design, with more features that Google Material Design Spec has introduced.

android-material-icons allows you to include any of the Material Design 1.0.1 icons by Google packed by Sergey Kupletsky in your texts, your ActionBar, and even in your EditTexts. Icons are infinitely scalable, and customizable with shadows and everything you can do on texts.
Materialize comes with useful helper classes, the complete material color palette, and many additional utils. Use its theme as base. Let it manage your StatusBar, NavigationBar, Fullscreen behavior…
The library provides two wrappers of MaterialMenuDrawable that eases implementation into the ActionBar, NavigationDrawer slide interaction or into any other custom layout.
Mixpanel is the most advanced analytics platform for mobile & web.

MPAndroidChart is a powerful and easy to use chart library for Android, supporting line-, bar-, scatter-, candlestick-, bubble-, pie- and radarcharts (spider web), as well as scaling, dragging (panning), selecting and animations.
Android library to observe scroll events on scrollable views.
Okio is a new library that complements java.io and java.nio to make it much easier to access, store, and process your data.
Compile-time active record ORM for Android.
Parallax ListView and ScrollView for Android
The Android SDK provides a flexible and easy to integrate payment solution for your Android applications.
A Job Queue specifically written for Android to easily schedule jobs (tasks) that run in the background, improving UX and application stability.

The LG QCircle design template library provides the layout designs and basic UI elements through API, enabling developers to save time designing and using repetitive tasks. The LG QCircle design template library provides various circle layouts and receives QuickCircle broadcast intents, adjusts layout position, and handles back button operation.
LG QSlide is the feature on LG smartphones to provide an application with multi-tasking using floating window and quick execution using Notification bar.
ReactiveNetwork is an Android library listening network connection state and Internet connectivity with RxJava Observables.
Rebound is a java library that models spring dynamics. Rebound spring models can be used to create animations that feel natural by introducing real world physics to your application.

The recyclerview library adds the RecyclerView class. This class provides support for the RecyclerView widget, a view for efficiently displaying large data sets by providing a limited window of data items.
RecyclerView Animators is an Android library that allows developers to easily create RecyclerView with animations.
Android Roboto Calendar View provides an easy and customizable calendar view with native support for the Roboto fonts, includes the brand new Roboto Slab fonts.
Reactive Extensions for the JVM – a library for composing asynchronous and event-based programs using observable sequences

Android specific bindings for RxJava.

This module adds the minimum classes to RxJava that make writing reactive components in Android applications easy and hassle-free. More specifically, it provides a Scheduler that schedules on the main UI thread or any given Handler.

RxJava is a Java VM implementation of Reactive Extensions: a library for composing asynchronous and event-based programs by using observable sequences.

It extends the observer pattern to support sequences of data/events and adds operators that allow you to compose sequences together declaratively while abstracting away concerns about things like low-level threading, synchronization, thread-safety and concurrent data structures.
The utilities provided here allow for automatic completion of sequences based on Activity or Fragment lifecycle events.
Side menu with some categories to choose.
A rating toggle for Android which switches between 3 rating levels: positive, neutral, and negative
A custom ViewPager title strip which gives continuous feedback to the user when scrolling
Library that implements Snackbars from Google\'s Material Design documentation.
This decorator allows you to easily create section headers for RecyclerViews using a LinearLayoutManager in either vertical or horizontal orientation
StickyListHeaders is an Android library that makes it easy to integrate section headers that stick to the top.
Stream API from Java 8 rewrited on iterators for Java 7 and below.
Insanely easy way to work with Android databases.
The Annotation package provides APIs to support adding annotation metadata to your apps.

This library is designed to be used with Android 1.6 (API level 4) and higher. It includes the largest set of APIs compared to the other libraries, including support for application components, user interface features, accessibility, data handling, network connectivity, and programming utilities.
Apply background tinting to the Android system UI when using KitKat translucent modes.
TextDrawable is a Drawable object used to display text content and is intended for use on the Android mobile platform.
VolleyPlus library Project improvements to Volley along with full image caching

You have blocked all notifications for Battery Saver. This will prevent Battery Saver from showing any notifications: the main notification and any alarms you have set will all be blocked.


Since Battery Saver already allows you to turn the main notification on or off as well as temporarily disable any alarms you've created, it is stongly recommended that you unblock the Battery Saver notifications. While they are blocked, it will appear that Battery Saver is broken.


Please press OK to be taken to the system settings where you can unblock notifications for Battery Saver.

This app can see the number being dialed during an outgoing call with the option to redirect the call to a different number or abort the call altogether. This can add charges to data plan and is a HIGH privacy risk.

If you want to temporarily disable an alarm without having to recreate it when you want it again, you can turn it off and on either here or on the main alarms page.

Sets whether the notification should enable the device\'s default lights. This generally flashes an LED or trackball. Note that every Android device I\'ve used has been slightly buggy in this department. If you have this checked, then the notification will request Android to flash lights, but it might not always actually happen.
Here you can control which sound to play when the alarm is triggered. Select \'Silent\' if you don\'t want a sound to be played.
For charge and temperature alarms, you need to set the temperature or charge level that will trigger the alarm.

There are currently five types of alarm that you can choose from.


The "Becomes fully charged" alarm will notify you when the status of your battery changes from "Charging" to "Fully Charged". Note that on many devices, this isn't necessarily the same thing as being at 100% charge.


The charge and temperature alarms require you to set a threshold below, after choosing that alarm type.


The "Health Fails" alarm will notify you if your battery health becomes something other than "Unknown" or "Good Health", as reported by Android.

If all goes well, setting this option will make the device vibrate when the alarm is triggered, unless the device is in Silent Mode, unless you have the device set up to vibrate even in Silent Mode. In other words, it should do what you expect. Please email me if something goes astray.
Whether or not to use an amber icon below the specified threshold.
Use amber icon when charge is medium?

Specifies the charge level which the icon should turn amber below (or at, in 10% Mode).


The options for the amber threshold include all the values (in multiples of 5) for which there are amber icons available, starting 5 percentage points above the red threshold (if there is one). For example, if you have the red threshold set to 15, then your lowest option here will be 20.


In 10% Mode, things work slightly differently but should be self-explanatory.
Amber icon below what charge percentage:
Amber icon at or below what charge percentage:

If you have the hack set to display mA in the main window, you can refresh the value by simply tapping it. If you want to see frequent updates without having to tap, you can enable this option to auto-refresh the value every two seconds while the window is visible.\n
\nNote that some devices rarely or never update the underlying data, so the value may not appear to change even though the app is refreshing the displayed value to match the data retrieved from the system.

Controls whether Battery Saver should start itself automatically when the device boots up.


The "If Running on Shutdown" option works with regard to whether you've most recently manually started or stopped Battery Saver. So if you kill Battery Saver through some other means, like a task killer, then Battery Saver doesn't know you stopped it, and it will still start at boot up if you have it set to this.


NOTE: Android will always start Battery Saver on boot if you have an Battery Saver desktop widgets. In that case this settings is irrelevant.
Start Battery Saver when device boots:
You have the same options for the bottom line as for the top line.
This is where you can control what conditions trigger the alarm.

In order to keep the binary package for Battery Saver reasonably small, there are some limitations for the colors. At the time of writing, you can have a red icon as high as 30%, an amber icon as high as 50%, and a green icon as low as 20%. I think these are reasonable compromises that should work for 99% of users.\n
\nTo give you maximum control, the colors can be turned on or off independently. This means that you can have as much as a four-tiered color scheme, where the icon is green when it is very full, then grayscale, then amber, then red. Of course, most people probably have the amber and green thresholds set to the same value, so that the icon is never grayscale.

You can override the colors for the notification text if the defaults are hard to read or if you just prefer something different. You can also choose to override whether or not to show a box around the icon area.

On Jelly Bean and up (Android 4.1 and over), notifications can have a priority set. The effect(s) of changing the priority are not guaranteed, but in general:


• Setting it to "Minimum" should in most cases remove the status bar icon but still show the notification in the pull-down notification tray.


• Setting it to "Low" should allow other notifications, such as new email, to appear above the Battery Saver notification. This is nice in cases like email where the notification is expandable (expandable notifications are automatically expanded when they are the top notification).


Priorities "Default" and above seem to usually leave Battery Saver as the top notification, but I imagine there are edge cases where the higher priorities make a difference.


Again, the exact behavior may vary between devices and is not guaranteed.
This is where you can control various aspects of the alarm notification that is created to notify you when an alarm has been triggered.

Starting with Android 5.0 (Lollipop), colored notification icons officially no longer work on Android, making the Classic icon show up as solid white. So by default, on these devices the app uses a plain white outline with white number.\n
\nHowever, not all devices follow the spec, so this is not necessary and does not work correctly everywhere. You can try to make the Classic icon set work in the classic way by turning this option on. Remember, on most devices this will just make the icon turn solid white.
This usually does not work; please read the help

The color preview will hopefully make it really easy to visualize what effect your color settings will have.\n
\nThis doesn\'t exist in 10% mode, because it just wouldn\'t make sense.
Android reports the battery temperature in degrees Celsius. If you prefer to see the battery temperature in degrees Fahrenheit, check this option, and the app will convert for you.

Starting in Lollipop (Android 5.0), Android now provides a somewhat less hackish way to access current (mA) information, directly from the system BatteryManager. However, it is still not guaranteed to work at all or to work well. Until Android Nougat (Android 7.0), the old (filesystem-based) hack method seems to work better on most devices, so it remains the default on devices running less than Android 7.0.\n
\nThis setting is just a hint to the hack about which method to prefer; you can try changing it if the hack isn\'t working well on your device.
Sorry, the current (mA) hack is not supported on this device.

When enabled, the hack will be attempted and will display the result in the main window. This value will be refreshed whenever the system sends new battery information, but you can refresh the value at any time by simply tapping the displayed value. (Note that some devices rarely or never update the underlying data, so the value may not appear to change on tap.)\n
\nOn most devices, a negative value indicates a net drain from the battery and a positive value indicates that the battery is being charged. Not all devices generate values this way, however.

When enabled, the hack will be attempted and will display the result in the main notification vital stats line. Note that you must have the main notification configured to display vital stats in order to see this. This value will only refresh when the system sends new battery information.\n
\nOn most devices, a negative value indicates a net drain from the battery and a positive value indicates that the battery is being charged. Not all devices generate values this way, however.
Display current (mA) in main notification vital stats?
Enter the number of seconds after which the apps will be locked again

Time is in seconds, 0 is unlimited
When this setting is enabled, the other options regarding the hack will be usable.
Attempt to enable the current (mA) hack?
If enabled, Battery Saver will log battery state changes.
Whether or not to use a green icon at or above the specified threshold.
Use green icon when charge is high?

Specifies the charge level which the icon should be green at or above.


The options for the green threshold include all the values (in multiples of 5) for which there are green icons available, starting at the highest active threshold you have set for red or amber. For example, if you have the amber threshold set to 40, then your lowest option here will be 40.


In 10% Mode, things work slightly differently but should be self-explanatory.
Green icon at or above what charge percentage:
Choose what you wish to see at the left end of the notification in the icon area. You can have just the battery graphic, just the textual charge percentage, or both, in either order.

Android comes in many flavors, so there is no one perfect icon set that works well on every device. Pro users can use plugins to get more options, but there are now three built-in icon sets that should provide at least one good option for virtually every device.


"Classic" is the original icon set from 2009. It is still the best on older devices, but newer versions of Android (starting with Android 3.0, Honeycomb) shrink and dim the notification icons, making this set very difficult to read.


"Plain number" is the default for all newer Android devices. It is a very large white number that shows up well even after being shrunk and dimmed. It shows a lightning bolt under the number during charging.


"Smaller number" is like "Plain number" but smaller, because some newer devices do not actually shrink the icon like stock Android does, and the very large number in "Plain Number" can appear comically large on these devices.


If you have any Battery Saver Pro icon plugins installed (press MENU, then Get Plugins to get free plugins, or just press the Get Plugins button on the Action Bar on newer devices), you can choose among them here.
Some icon sets indicate when the battery is being charged, for example by showing a lightning bolt below the number. Disable this setting if you would prefer it not to do that.
Alter icon to indicate when charging?
If the translation to your language is incomplete or inaccurate and you would prefer another, possibly better translation, you may choose to do so here.
Set the priority of the main notification. Alarms, plugins, and any other notifications are not affected by this setting, but they may in the future have configurable priority.
If logging is enabled, then whenever you plug in your device, logs older than this will be deleted.

Enable this setting if you\'d prefer the main notification to show the time since the status changed (e.g., \"Unplugged for 5 hours\") rather than the estimate of time remaining. Both pieces of information are available from the main window.
Show time since status changed rather than estimate of time remaining?
The Pro version has many more settings and features, including current (mA) information, colorful icons, alarms, battery state logging, and more.

Here you can select how Battery Saver Pro will predict your remaining battery life / time until fully charged.


The "Sensitive" algorithm is strictly based on your last five minutes of usage. If your primary concern is "How long will my battery last if I keep doing what I'm doing?" then this is the algorithm for you.


The "Conservative" algorithm is the default. It is also based on recent usage, but it tries not to vary from your long-term average too freely.


Select "Since Status Change" to have the prediction based strictly on your current session.


Finally, you can have the prediction based solely on your long-term average usage.

Some systems have a further hack available, giving a recent average of the current rather than an instantaneous reading of it. What this means varies from device to device and is only available on some devices. This may give a more stable value (if all goes well), it may return the same value, or it may return an unusable value (in which case you should turn this option off).
Try to use current_avg in main window?
Try to use current_avg in main notification vital stats?

The options for the red threshold include all the values (in multiples of 5) for which there are red icons available.


In 10% Mode, things work slightly differently but should be self-explanatory.

If set, the vital signs line will also include the number of hours since the device became unplugged, plugged in, or fully charged.
Include Time Since Status Change in Vital Signs?

Note: Checking or unchecking this will reset your icon color settings!


This setting cleans up the Icon Color settings to make more sense on devices that only show their charge level in 10% increments. According to user reports, that includes these devices:


• Motorola Droid (original) 
• Motorola Droid X 
• Motorola Droid 2 
• Motorola Defy 
• Samsung Moment


As far as I'm aware, all other devices report every 1%, and so should not turn this on.

Devices come in all shapes and sizes, so most translations need to use abbreviations to ensure that the time-remaining estimate fits comfortably in the notification area. If it still doesn\'t fit, you can opt for the condensed format. If you have plenty of room, you might prefer the verbose setting.

Configure what goes in the top line of the notification: estimated time remaining (configurable elsewhere), how long since the status has changed (plugged in, unplugged, or fully charged), or the battery vital signs (battery health, temperature, and voltage).

If enabled, the system notification layout will be used instead of Battery Saver\'s custom layout. The system layout is less customizable, but a small minority of devices don\'t report default colors properly, making the custom layout ugly or hard to read. Other devices use an unusual layout, making the custom layout not fit in. Selecting this option will ensure that the notification will look like any other notification.\n
\nNote that this will result in having the status bar icon used in the notification.
